page.title: 12 Conservation,Friar's Court
page.content: The farmer, a keen conservationist, has set up a farm trail around the new woodland areas that he has created. He started this project in 1951 and was made especially aware of the disappearance of farm trees after Dutch Elm Disease and storm damage had affected his woods. By planting broad shelter belts of trees and bushes alongside some of the hedges, he is hoping to create suitable habitats to encourage the right birds and insects to help his efforts to control pests naturally. Experiments during this last year, have shown that corn treated with chemical sprays was no better than an untreated crop, grown in a field from which slugs were eaten by birds and aphids were removed by ladybirds from the nearby willows.
